channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2583] Confirmed: R2-D2 Finally Discovered In Star Trek (IMAGE)
item.description: At last, here's the droid we were all looking for: This is the frame in which you can clearly see R2-D2 in Star Trek. This time there is absolutely no doubt about it: It's confirmed by the sequence supervisor at ILM. Zoom in to see.

[+1355] In her memoir, Palin says she doesn't believe in evolution
item.description: Palin talks about creationism, saying she “didn’t believe in the theory that human beings — thinking, loving beings — originated from fish that sprouted legs and crawled out of the sea” or from “monkeys who eventually swung down from the trees.”

item.title: [+1130] Harry Gets High ! The Harry Potter.
item.description: In a huge “scandal,” Harry Potter star Daniel Radcliffe has allegedly been revealed as (a totally normal young adult) a drug-taking heathen. The Mirror claims that Daniel was at a party at a high-rise flat in Camden when he was spotted smoking spliffs and going around saying “I love weed.”

item.title: [+940] Linux Contractor Fired for Using Firefox/Linux
item.description: This is a complicated story but one that must be told. I'm not sure there is anything that can be done about it except rage at the moon...

item.title: [+937] Google Could Double Web Speeds With SPDY Protocol
item.description: Slowly but surely, we're getting an idea of what Google's Chrome OS will look like. We know that it will be Linux-based and that the primary interface will likely be the Chrome browser. Still, the search giant was not content to simply turn a Web browser into an operating system.

item.title: [+689] Baby Boomers Find Growing Public Acceptance Of Marijuana Use
item.description: Smoking pot isn't what it used to be for Joe Lee, a 62-year-old vintage-record dealer in Rockville, Maryland. Back in the late 1960s, as an art student in Baltimore, he kept his landlord in a constant state of suspicion, with clouds of marijuana smoke poorly masked by clouds of incense. These days, after four decades, cannabis is a smaller deal.

item.title: [+672] 12 Comics Who Aren't Funny [pics]
item.description: A hat tip to a dirty dozen of the world's least funny comedians.
